previous_with_titles.title: Prepare Add-ins
previous_with_titles.text: Mix that reserved tablespoon of the flour mixture with one-and-a-half cups of fresh blueberries. The reason why we add that little tiny bit of flour to those blueberries is when we add them to the batter. During baking the blueberries don't sink as fast when they're coated in flour.

previous_with_titles.title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
previous_with_titles.text: Add three eggs into a large bowl and whisk them on high speed using an electric mixer. You want to do this for about three minutes until the eggs become fluffy and pale. Continue beating the eggs as you slowly add one cup of granulated sugar. You'll want to keep beating those eggs for about three more minutes. The key to really fluffy muffins is well beaten eggs. Add a teaspoon of vanilla extract and a tablespoon of fresh lemon juice.

previous_with_titles.title: Prepare Add-ins
previous_with_titles.text: Before the muffins go into the oven you want to make that simple streusel. In a small bowl combine a 1 tablespoon of unsalted. Add cold cubed butter. Add 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, a teaspoon of cinnamon, and 3 tablespoons of brown sugar. Mash that all together using a fork until the ingredients are well combined and they have a crumbly texture to them.

global.explanation: The video explains the importance of using a scale for accurate measurement and provides a link to a detailed video on measuring flour correctly.
global.gap_description: The user may not understand the importance of accurately measuring dry ingredients, especially flour, which can affect the outcome of baking.
global.label: -Procedure-

global.explanation: The video demonstrates how to pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until almost combined, leaving some clumps of flour.
global.gap_description: The user may not know the correct method to combine wet and dry ingredients to avoid overmixing.
global.label: -Procedure-

global.explanation: The video shows how to fold in chocolate chips using a spatula instead of a whisk to avoid overmixing.
global.gap_description: The user may not understand the correct technique to fold in chocolate chips without overmixing the batter.
global.label: -Procedure-

global.explanation: The video explains how to butter and flour muffin tins and the use of muffin papers, including the differences in the final product.
global.gap_description: The user may not know the different methods to prepare muffin tins and their effects on the final product.
global.label: -Procedure-

global.explanation: The video instructs to bake at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 5 minutes, then reduce to 350 degrees and continue baking for 20-25 minutes.
global.gap_description: The user may not understand the importance of adjusting the oven temperature during baking to achieve the best results.
global.label: -Procedure-

global.explanation: The video provides a step-by-step guide to making a simple streusel topping with brown sugar, flour, butter, and cinnamon.
global.gap_description: The user may not know how to make a streusel topping for muffins.
global.label: -Procedure-

global.explanation: The video explains a master muffin recipe and demonstrates five different variations, showing how to build upon the base recipe.
global.gap_description: The user may not be aware of how to use a master muffin recipe to create different flavors.
global.label: -Procedure-

local.explanation: The video 'gN-orgrgvU8' provides a clear and engaging introduction by introducing the host and the recipe, which helps set the stage for the cooking process.
local.gap_description: The user may not understand the importance of a clear and engaging introduction in a cooking video.
local.label: Introduction

local.explanation: The video 'cZ2KJPGVwNU' demonstrates how to introduce a master recipe, emphasizing its versatility and importance.
local.gap_description: The user may not be aware of how to introduce a master recipe effectively.
local.label: Introduction

local.explanation: The video explains that room temperature ingredients mix more smoothly and evenly, preventing clumps. It also provides a solution if ingredients get too cold.
local.gap_description: The user may not understand why wet ingredients should be at room temperature.
local.label: Prepare Wet Ingredients

local.explanation: The video demonstrates how to whisk eggs until they become fluffy and pale, which is crucial for the desired texture in baking.
local.gap_description: The user may not know the importance of properly whisking eggs to achieve the right texture for wet ingredients.
local.label: Prepare Wet Ingredients

local.explanation: The video segment explains the flexibility in using different types of chocolate (semi-sweet, bittersweet, milk chocolate) and their impacts on the recipe.
local.gap_description: Uncertainty about substituting different types of chocolate in recipes.
local.label: Prepare Add-ins

local.explanation: The video segment describes the technique of coating blueberries with flour to prevent them from sinking in the batter during baking.
local.gap_description: Lack of knowledge on how to prevent add-ins like blueberries from sinking during baking.
local.label: Prepare Add-ins
